page.title: 05ST STEPHENS CHURCH, YSTRAD
page.content: THE Church was opened on 4th May,1896. It is part of the parish of Ystradyfodwg, that dates back to the 6th century. The Church of St. Stephens is the focal point for community activity, involving various clubs, organizations and institutions, including youth organizations such as the Scouts, Guides and Adventure Scouts, who involve themselves in Church and Community projects in the Rhondda Valley. The present vicar of the Church is the Rev.H.Rhydderch. Within the church grounds is a memorialto servicemen killed in the lst and 2nd World Wars from Ystrad, Rhondda. Outside the Church gate is a memorial to the victims of the Hiroshima Atom Bomb of 1945.
